discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: HI @jouvelot you seem to have made this branch out of an outdated version of master. You should rebase on top of master before doing any PR. The command is `git pull --rebase upstream master`

discussion.author: jouvelot
discussion.comment:
Thanks a lot, Cyril. I tried that command, and got
```
[nix-shell:~/Desktop/ownCloud/Github/pierre/math-comp]$ git status
On branch tuple_uniqP
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/tuple_uniqP'.

Untracked files:
  (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)
	.emacs
	mathcomp/algebra/ssrtelescope.v

nothing added to commit but untracked files present (use "git add" to track)

[nix-shell:~/Desktop/ownCloud/Github/pierre/math-comp]$ git pull --rebase upstream master
fatal: 'upstream' does not appear to be a git repository
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
```
Any suggestion before I create a new PR from scratch, for this small piece of code?

discussion.comment:

Dear @jouvelot, this conversation is evolving into git debbuging, and I need more information on your local setup, please let's switch to zulip for such questions.

discussion.author: jouvelot
discussion.comment: Yes, I was having this feeling too ;) To avoid wasting your time, I'll try to make a new clean PR asap. Thanks for your help :)

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: You do not need to close, you can rebase and update this one...

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> You do not need to close, you can rebase and update this one...

@jouvelot I reopened, rebased and simplified the hypotheses and the proof of your lemma.

discussion.author: jouvelot
discussion.comment: Thanks a lot, Cyril. And the lemma and proof are much nicer :)

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment: Dear @jouvelot you added a commit (13e3440) which makes the history dirty since it's an empty merge commit. Could you clarify your intentions with this commit, did you intended to bring an additional fix or should I discard it and merge?

discussion.author: jouvelot
discussion.comment: Hello @CohenCyril. I'm not sure where this comes from; maybe because I tried to clean up my PR before seeing your message stating that you had already done it for me. My knowledge of git is marginal, at best ;) So, yes, you can discard it and merge. Thanks a lot and sorry for the inconvenience.

discussion.author: proux01
discussion.comment: Added changelog, let's merge when CI is green.
